meanings.definition: Not oneself; not one's usual or true self.
meanings.sent1: She wore a nonself mask to the party, pretending to be someone else.
meanings.sent2: The actor's nonself behavior on stage surprised the audience.
meanings.sent3: He tried to act nonself by speaking in a fake accent, but everyone knew it was him.
meanings.sent4: The nonself character in the movie was so convincing, it felt like a different person.
meanings.sent5: The nonself attitude she displayed was a stark contrast to her usual cheerful self.

meanings.definition: Not belonging to oneself; not originating from oneself.
meanings.sent1: The nonself book on the shelf must belong to someone else.
meanings.sent2: The nonself ideas in the presentation seemed out of place.
meanings.sent3: Finding a nonself note in his pocket, he realized he must have picked up the wrong one.
meanings.sent4: The nonself music playing in the cafe transported her to a different world.
meanings.sent5: The nonself aroma in the kitchen hinted that someone else had been cooking.
